title: What channel is Man Utd vs Liverpool on? TV and live stream information
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest football stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

One of England’s biggest fixtures is upon us, with league leaders Liverpool travelling to Old Trafford to take on a shaky Manchester United .

The Red Devils have had a torrid spell of form since Ole Gunnar Solskjaer was given the permanent manager’s job, winning only two of their opening eight games.

Liverpool have won all of their opening eight, and can reestablish their eight point gap ahead of title challengers Manchester City .

United boss Solskjaer is in the firing line at the moment, and win against Liverpool will be a much needed morale booster and a potential turn in their fortunes.

Here is all the key information ahead of the game...

(Image: Getty Images)

When is Manchester United vs Liverpool?

The game will kick off at 4:30pm on Sunday 20th October.

Where can I watch it?

The game will be televised on Sky Sports Premier League and Sky Sports Main Event from 3:00pm.

Will it be live streamed?

The match will be live streamed on the Sky Sports app for Sky Sports customers.

Odds

Manchester United: 7/2

Draw: 14/5

Liverpool: 3/4
description: Two of the Premier League's all-time biggest rivals face off at Old Trafford with the sides in differing situations
